intro: Cremastra guizhouensis, commonly known as the Guizhou cremastra, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tubular, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas at moderate elevations. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
